datasource.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

count.description: Maximum number of entries to return.

skip_to.description: Skip to Nth CMDB entry. Only collect statistical data after it.

with_meta.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

with_contents_hash.description: Enable to include a checksum of each object's contents.

skip.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

format.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

filter.description:
Filtering multiple key/value pairs
Operator     |   Description
==     |   Case insensitive match with pattern.
!=     |    Does not match with pattern (case insensitive).
=@     |    Pattern found in object value (case insensitive).
!@     |    ﻿Pattern not﻿ found in object value (case insensitive).
<=     |    Value must be less than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
<     |    Value must be less than pattern﻿.
.>=    |    Value must be greater than or equal to ﻿pattern﻿.
.>     |    Value must be greater than ﻿pattern﻿.
Logical OR    |    Separate filters using commas ','
Logical AND    |    Filter strings can be combined to create logical AND queries by including multiple filters in the request.
Combining AND and OR    |    You can combine AND and OR filters together to create more complex filters.

key.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this name.

pattern.description: If present, objects will be filtered on property with this value.

datasource_format.description: A map of datasources to a string of attributes, separated by | (ie: policyid|srcintf). If specified, this will add the attributes listed for any linked objects.

unfiltered_count.description: Maximum number of unfiltered entries to interate through.

stat-items.description: Items to count occurrence in entire response (multiple items should be separated by '|').

primary_keys.description: The primary key to find indexes for.

action.description:
default: Return the CLI default values for entire CLI tree.
meta: Return meta data for a specific object, table, or the entire CLI tree.
json-schema: Return JSON Schema for entire CLI tree.
schema: Return schema for entire CLI tree.

vdom.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

action.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

before.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

after.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

scope.description:
Specify the Scope from which results are returned or changes are applied to. Objects are only existed in global scope.
scope=global

GET.summary:
Select all entries in a CLI table.
 Access Group: wifi

PUT.summary:
Update this specific resource.
 Access Group: wifi

location.name: location
location.help: Description of the location of the wireless controller.

acd-process-count.name: acd-process-count
acd-process-count.help: Configure the number cw_acd daemons for multi-core CPU support (default = 0).

wpad-process-count.name: wpad-process-count
wpad-process-count.help: Wpad daemon process count for multi-core CPU support.

image-download.name: image-download
image-download.help: Enable/disable WTP image download at join time.

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable WTP image download at join time.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable WTP image download at join time

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable WTP image download at join time.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable WTP image download at join time

rolling-wtp-upgrade-threshold.name: rolling-wtp-upgrade-threshold
rolling-wtp-upgrade-threshold.help: Minimum signal level/threshold in dBm required for the managed WTP to be included in rolling WTP upgrade (-95 to -20, default = -80).

max-retransmit.name: max-retransmit
max-retransmit.help: Maximum number of tunnel packet retransmissions (0 - 64, default = 3).

control-message-offload.name: control-message-offload
control-message-offload.help: Configure CAPWAP control message data channel offload.

options.name: stats
options.help: WTP, radio, VAP, and STA statistics.
options.label: Stats
options.description: WTP, radio, VAP, and STA statistics

control-message-offload.default_value: ebp-frame aeroscout-tag ap-list sta-list sta-cap-list stats aeroscout-mu sta-health spectral-analysis

data-ethernet-II.name: data-ethernet-II
data-ethernet-II.help: Configure the wireless controller to use Ethernet II or 802.3 frames with 802.3 data tunnel mode (default = enable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Use Ethernet II frames with 802.3 data tunnel mode.
options.label: Enable

options.name: disable
options.help: Use 802.3 Ethernet frames with 802.3 data tunnel mode.
options.label: Disable

link-aggregation.name: link-aggregation
link-aggregation.help: Enable/disable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash to load balance sessions to link aggregation nodes (default = disable).

options.name: enable
options.help: Enable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash.
options.label: Enable
options.description: Enable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash

options.name: disable
options.help: Disable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash.
options.label: Disable
options.description: Disable calculating the CAPWAP transmit hash

mesh-eth-type.name: mesh-eth-type
mesh-eth-type.help: Mesh Ethernet identifier included in backhaul packets (0 - 65535, default = 8755).

fiapp-eth-type.name: fiapp-eth-type
fiapp-eth-type.help: Ethernet type for Fortinet Inter-Access Point Protocol (IAPP), or IEEE 802.11f, packets (0 - 65535, default = 5252).

discovery-mc-addr.name: discovery-mc-addr
discovery-mc-addr.help: Multicast IP address for AP discovery (default = 244.0.1.140).

discovery-mc-addr6.name: discovery-mc-addr6
discovery-mc-addr6.help: Multicast IPv6 address for AP discovery (default = FF02::18C).

max-clients.name: max-clients
max-clients.help: Maximum number of clients that can connect simultaneously (default = 0, meaning no limitation).

rogue-scan-mac-adjacency.name: rogue-scan-mac-adjacency
rogue-scan-mac-adjacency.help: Maximum numerical difference between an AP's Ethernet and wireless MAC values to match for rogue detection (0 - 31, default = 7).

ipsec-base-ip.name: ipsec-base-ip
ipsec-base-ip.help: Base IP address for IPsec VPN tunnels between the access points and the wireless controller (default = 169.254.0.1).

wtp-share.name: wtp-share
wtp-share.help: Enable/disable sharing of WTPs between VDOMs.

options.name: enable
options.help: WTP can be shared between all VDOMs.
options.label: Enable
options.description: WTP can be shared between all VDOMs

options.name: disable
options.help: WTP can be used only in its own VDOM.
options.label: Disable
options.description: WTP can be used only in its own VDOM

options.name: compatible
options.help: Allow for backward compatible ciphers(3DES+SHA1+Strong list).
options.label: Compatible
options.description: Allow for backward compatible ciphers(3DES+SHA1+Strong list)

nac-interval.name: nac-interval
nac-interval.help: Interval in seconds between two WiFi network access control (NAC) checks (10 - 600, default = 120).

ap-log-server.name: ap-log-server
ap-log-server.help: Enable/disable configuring FortiGate to redirect wireless event log messages or FortiAPs to send UTM log messages to a syslog server (default = disable).

ap-log-server-ip.name: ap-log-server-ip
ap-log-server-ip.help: IP address that FortiGate or FortiAPs send log messages to.

ap-log-server-port.name: ap-log-server-port
ap-log-server-port.help: Port that FortiGate or FortiAPs send log messages to.

max-sta-offline.name: max-sta-offline
max-sta-offline.help: Maximum number of station offline stored on the controller (default = 0).

max-sta-offline-ip2mac.name: max-sta-offline-ip2mac
max-sta-offline-ip2mac.help: Maximum number of station offline ip2mac stored on the controller (default = 0).

max-sta-cap.name: max-sta-cap
max-sta-cap.help: Maximum number of station cap stored on the controller (default = 0).

max-sta-cap-wtp.name: max-sta-cap-wtp
max-sta-cap-wtp.help: Maximum number of station cap's wtp info stored on the controller (1 - 16, default = 8).

max-rogue-ap.name: max-rogue-ap
max-rogue-ap.help: Maximum number of rogue APs stored on the controller (default = 0).

max-rogue-ap-wtp.name: max-rogue-ap-wtp
max-rogue-ap-wtp.help: Maximum number of rogue AP's wtp info stored on the controller (1 - 16, default = 16).

max-rogue-sta.name: max-rogue-sta
max-rogue-sta.help: Maximum number of rogue stations stored on the controller (default = 0).

max-wids-entry.name: max-wids-entry
max-wids-entry.help: Maximum number of wids entries stored on the controller (default = 0).

max-ble-device.name: max-ble-device
max-ble-device.help: Maximum number of BLE devices stored on the controller (default = 0).
